quotes.quote: Not all those who wander are lost.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
quotes.author: Emily Brontë

quotes.quote: Get busy living or get busy dying.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.quote: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: The only way out of the labyrinth of suffering is to forgive.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.quote: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.book: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

quotes.quote: Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing.
quotes.author: Harper Lee

quotes.quote: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou
quotes.book: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings

quotes.quote: A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies. The man who never reads lives only one.
quotes.author: George R.R. Martin

quotes.quote: It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.book: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

quotes.quote: All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.quote: Whatever you are physically... male or female, strong or weak, ill or healthy—all those things matter less than what your heart contains.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.book: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

quotes.quote: The man in black fled across the desert, and the gunslinger followed.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.quote: There is no charm equal to tenderness of heart.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: The past is not dead. It is not even past.
quotes.author: William Faulkner

quotes.quote: To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling
quotes.book: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

quotes.quote: The answer to the ultimate question of life, the universe, and everything is 42.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams
quotes.book: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quotes.quote: Stay gold, Ponyboy, stay gold.
quotes.author: S.E. Hinton

quotes.quote: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: Whatever you think the world is withholding from you, you are withholding from the world.
quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.quote: But soft! What light through yonder window breaks?
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: There are darknesses in life and there are lights, and you are one of the lights, the light of all lights.
quotes.author: Bram Stoker

quotes.quote: It is not down on any map; true places never are.
quotes.author: Herman Melville

quotes.quote: It’s no use going back to yesterday, because I was a different person then.
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll

quotes.quote: We are all fools in love.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget.
quotes.author: Cormac McCarthy

quotes.quote: Books are a uniquely portable magic.
quotes.author: Stephen King
quotes.book: On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft

quotes.quote: So many books, so little time.
quotes.author: Frank Zappa

quotes.quote: Once you learn to read, you will be forever free.
quotes.author: Frederick Douglass

quotes.quote: Reading gives us someplace to go when we have to stay where we are.
quotes.author: Mason Cooley

quotes.quote: Between the pages of a book is a lovely place to be.
quotes.author: Unknown

quotes.quote: The only thing that you absolutely have to know, is the location of the library.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: I have always imagined that paradise will be a kind of library.
quotes.author: Jorge Luis Borges

quotes.quote: Books are mirrors: you only see in them what you already have inside you.
quotes.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

quotes.quote: If you don’t like to read, you haven’t found the right book.
quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

quotes.quote: Fill your house with stacks of books, in all the crannies and all the nooks.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss
